abstract: Editorial praises Hillary Clinton's willingness to consider allowing Americans under 65 to buy into Medicare; notes potential challenges from Republican lawmakers, medical professionals who prefer higher reimbursement rates paid by private insurers, and insurers who fear competing with government.

headline.print_headline: A Medicare Option for the Uninsured
headline.main: A Medicare Option for the Uninsured

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Allowing people to buy into Medicare may be politically difficult, but it is important to explore what could be done to expand health coverage.
lead_paragraph: Allowing people to buy into Medicare may be politically difficult, but it is important to explore what could be done to expand health coverage.
